articles.headline: Candidates Advance Final Arguments
articles.snippet: Republicans made final arguments for capturing control of Congress as the ranks of vulnerable Democrats deepened and the White House sought to minimize the damage.
articles.abstract: Republicans made final arguments for capturing control of Congress as the ranks of vulnerable Democrats deepened and the White House sought to minimize the damage.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Republicans made their closing argument on Sunday for capturing control of Congress, assailing President Obama as a champion of wasteful and excessive government, as Democrats countered that returning power to Republicans would embolden corporations and the wealthy with disastrous results for middle-class Americans.

articles.headline: Rally to Shift the Blame
articles.snippet: At his Rally to Restore Sanity, Jon Stewart was unwilling to take a stand in the culture wars. So he opened fire on a bystander: the news media.
articles.abstract: At his Rally to Restore Sanity, Jon Stewart was unwilling to take a stand in the culture wars. So he opened fire on a bystander: the news media.
articles.lead_paragraph: In his new role as a political leader, which is what you call somebody if he hosts a rally on the Washington Mall for over 200,000 people, Jon Stewart was a little hemmed at the Rally to Restore Sanity on Saturday. Because sanity should know no party, partisan rhetoric was not on the teleprompter.

articles.headline: ImClone Ex-Chief Embarks on New Biotech Venture
articles.snippet: Not yet two years after serving time for insider trading, Samuel Waksal is again making deals.
articles.abstract: Not yet two years after serving time for insider trading, Samuel Waksal is again making deals.
articles.lead_paragraph: Samuel D. Waksal is not letting his past stand in the way of his future.

articles.headline: Boehner Offers G.O.P. for 2010 Version of Change
articles.snippet: John A. Boehner, who hopes to be the next speaker, is running against Washington after 18 years in Congress.
articles.abstract: John A. Boehner, who hopes to be the next speaker, is running against Washington after 18 years in Congress.
articles.lead_paragraph: HANOVERTON, Ohio  The speaker in waiting was waiting to speak, perched atop a bale of hay on a small platform outside the Spread Eagle Tavern, where the windows were draped with patriotic red, white and blue bunting.

articles.headline: Debt Collectors Face a Hazard: Writer’s Cramp
articles.snippet: Debt buyers used questionable tactics well before the recent foreclosure mess, lawyers say.
articles.abstract: Debt buyers used questionable tactics well before the recent foreclosure mess, lawyers say.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Michael Gazzarato took a job that required him to sign hundreds of affidavits in a single day, he had one demand for his employer: a much better pen.

articles.headline: Awaiting Fed’s Plans, Markets Are in Limbo
articles.snippet: Whatever the election outcome, the Federal Reserve is widely expected to take new steps this week to spur the nation’s snail-paced recovery.
articles.abstract: Whatever the election outcome, the Federal Reserve is widely expected to take new steps this week to spur the nation’s snail-paced recovery.
articles.lead_paragraph: Everyone on Wall Street is waiting on the Fed.

articles.headline: Conservative Donor Groups Lay a Base for 2012 Elections
articles.snippet: Buoyed by the impact that their campaigns have had, two large, new conservative groups are planning to keep pushing their agenda.
articles.abstract: Buoyed by the impact that their campaigns have had, two large, new conservative groups are planning to keep pushing their agenda.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The midterm election campaign will end Tuesday, but one of its most marked developments  the emergence of outside groups, often backed by anonymous donations, that can direct waves of advertising into political battles  is just getting started.

articles.headline: Lost the Remote? Another Reason to Use an App
articles.snippet: The locus of control in the family room is being replaced, mostly by smartphones.
articles.abstract: The locus of control in the family room is being replaced, mostly by smartphones.
articles.lead_paragraph: The standard TV remote control, lost so many times beneath sofa cushions, may soon be lost to history.

articles.headline: A Donation Clouds Fox News Report
articles.snippet: Questions are being raised over the Fox Business Network’s failure to disclose the News Corporation’s $1.3 million donation to defeat Proposition 24.
articles.abstract: Questions are being raised over the Fox Business Network’s failure to disclose the News Corporation’s $1.3 million donation to defeat Proposition 24.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Fox Business Network focused on what it called “The War on Business” all last week, but on Tuesday its coverage was decidedly more focused  with a series of reports about a California ballot initiative that its parent company, the News Corporation, had spent $1.3 million to defeat.

articles.headline: Earlier Flight May Have Been Dry Run for Plotters
articles.snippet: U.S. intelligence officials tracked shipments from Yemen to Chicago in September and considered the possibility they might be a test for a terrorist attack, an official said.
articles.abstract: U.S. intelligence officials tracked shipments from Yemen to Chicago in September and considered the possibility they might be a test for a terrorist attack, an official said.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  American intelligence officials in September intercepted several packages containing books, papers, CDs and other household items shipped to Chicago from Yemen and considered the possibility that the parcels might be a test run for a terrorist attack, two officials said Monday night.
articles.byline: By Scott Shane and Robert F. Worth
